subject: Entrustment of stretches
text: HRdf1u <fu <TTHT ufarrut Phone 91-11-25074100/2574200 Fax 91-11-25093507/25093514 (19r #aa7t & 7th TATTT4) Extn. 2223/2318/2468/255: 172 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport & Highways) G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/21/2002-Admn: 3rd Feb., 2004 POLICY MATTER ADMINSTRATIONFINANCE (69/2004) [Decision taken on CO Division File No. NHAI/13013/3/03-O4/CMD-COIPolicy on toll (Pt:)] Sub: Entrustment of Stretches It has come to notice that certain sections of National Highways or part thereof have not been entrusted to NHAI by the MoRT&H where NHAI is supposed to take up the work. Such entrustment is a pre-requisite before the start of civil construction work for that section. It has therefore been desired by the Competent Authority that all Technical sections in NHAI must carefully  examine the notifications of the stretches entrusted to NHAI in their jurisdiction and pass on a copy of these notifications to General  Manager(Estate Management)  for his record and reference. One copy of notificationswhich available in Library may also-be passed on to GMEM): The concerned Technical Division shall up draft notification to the GM(EM) for entrustment of the stretches which have not been entrusted to NHAI SO far and GMEM) will be the nodal authority for liaisoning with the Ministry for issue of such notification and he will ensure that all notifications are issued well in time. 2. The GMEM) will also ensure that notification number & date of entrustment are compiled and placed in the permanent record of IT division: In case any entrustment notification is pending in the Ministry which has been referred to the Ministry by NHAI; copies of references to the Ministry may also be sent to GM(EM) for follow up action. 3_ This issues with the approval of the Competent Authority: 8. A99 axall (S.Loganathan) General Manager (Admh ) All officers at HQs. All PDsISPVs NMAL Orz put
